fields.description:
Discuss ideas to improve documentation:

Identify users (Confluence User, Confluence Admin., System Admin., Extension developer) and suggest appropriate documentation for each.

Make certain that we are adding documentation in the same way - this might need to be articulated - so that we have a consistent documentation base as Confluence grows in size.
fields.summary: Discuss documentation tactics

fields.description:
Exceptions propagate outside the mail-retrieving loop, so if a single mail causes an exception, the whole loop is terminated.

This is obviously not good.

Fixed in the post-release-announcement 1.3 zips, but early adopters will need to install the attached replacement class file.
fields.summary: Atlassian stops getting mail if it can't parse one message

fields.description:
Sulka made the following observation:

"During the 60+ minute import my browser timed out. When I tried to load a page from Confluence during this time I get a System Error:  com.opensymphony.xwork.config.ConfigurationException: There is no Action mapped for namespace /setup and action name complete. The error didn't go away until I restarted Confluence after it had seemed to finish the importing - I have no way of knowing since the import/setup process doesn't issue a "import complete" type messages into the log."

It's a potential flaw in the design of the setupwizard (both versions) that we write <setupStep>complete</setupStep> in a field which is otherwised associated with xwork configured actions, but it is a side effect of a check on bootstrapManager.isSetupComplete() returning a false, after setupPersister.finishSetup() has been called; the latter sets the setupComplete flag on applicationConfig, the former reads it.

So either the wrong value is being set or the wrong value is being read.

Confirm and fix for 1.3.1 .

It's worthwhile to remember that this bug is being reported after a 60 minute setup procedure ...
fields.summary: Erraticity in state of applicationConfig

fields.description:

Mail account summary needs more information

fields.description: In the release version of 1.3, the packaged xerces-2.1.1.jar is corrupted which prevents Confluence from starting up. Replacing the jar fixes the issue and no other files seem corrupted.
fields.summary: xerces-2.1.1.jar is corrupt

fields.description: velocity.log is generated into the confluence installation directory, not the logs directory under it. Not critical due to aggressive log turnaround configuration but doesn't follow the logging convention of the other parts of the application.
fields.summary: Velocity logs to confluence main directory, not logs

fields.description: Every imported email seems to be printed into catalina.out in full. Please disable this unnecessary and potentially insecure logging.
fields.summary: Imported email is logged into catalina.out

fields.description: After starting Confluence 1.3 final on OS X, a row stating "WebappClassLoader: Lifecycle error : CL stopped" is logged into catalina.out every few seconds.
fields.summary: Lifecycle errors in log

fields.description: Confluence allows importing email even if no POP boxes are configured but doesn't allow viewing email without having at least one box. I guess the importing feature was added later and someone just didn't remove the requisite for having the boxes configured - I guess you should be checking if there's email stored instead.
fields.summary: Viewing email is disallowed if POP boxes aren't configured

fields.description:
If you try to import a file which is not an MBOX file using the mail import feature, Confluence seems to try to parse it which can take a very long time and then import it as just one message which results in a Hibernate exception for a too large package.

Proposed fix: if Confluence can't find email in the first few kBytes of the file, consider it to not to be email and not even try the import.
fields.summary: Trying to import non-mbox file as an mbox file causes mayhem

fields.description:
On Backup & Restore Mask, Var names instead of content is displayed:

That way we don't have to fix up the dodgy tab stops.

fields.description:
Flush cache after deleting user - spacepermissions cache still seemed to hold a reference to a deleted user.

I encountered this after working on spacepermissions for usernames with mixed casing. After deleting the user, using Confluence, I had to delete the spacepermission, in the db. Even so, a cached version of the bad spacepermission remained. It might be part of a larger issue: (see link)
fields.summary: spacepermission cache is not being cleared for deleted users with mixed casing

Document gallery macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2265].
  {panel}

Put {expires:7d} in a page.

After seven days, the page will have a nice box at the top saying "The information on this page may be out of date", and watchers of the page will receive an email notification that the page needs to be updated.

This is best done as a plugin combo: a macro and a service. Which means we'll need to add services to Confluence.

Suggested by Micheal Taylor on the confluence-users list:

"We are thinking of switching to Confluence from Twiki.  One thing that seems to be missing is notification for out-of-date pages.  We use this heavily in Twiki.  When you edit a page, you get a few radio buttons at the bottom of the edit page where you can select how long a page is valid for before it becomes out-of-date (a week, a month, a year, etc).

When a user visits an out-of-date page, there is a warning at the top that the page may be out-of-date.  As well, the last editor of the page receives an email periodically saying which pages are out-of-date.

We would miss this sorely if we went to confluence.  I would probably have to write some sort of replacement of my own.

Does anything like this exist in Confluence?"
fields.summary: Expires macro

Is there an easy way to export all the existing wiki users and emails ?

Suggestions are very welcome.

Kind regards,
Stephan Janssen

fields.description:
A Quick Search for specific keywords generates a MethodInvocationException for SearchSiteAction.getResults(). 

For example, go to http://opensource.atlassian.com/confluence/spring/ and do a Quick Search for "lock" or "locking". Both produced the attached error. Searching for "locker" just comes back with no search hits.

I don't have access to the app server log file, but have attached the stack trace and system information.
fields.summary: MethodInvocationException for some quick searches

For example if we could see where data is redudantly duplicated, that would be powerful indeed :)

I would like our users (we have a distributed team) to have thier pictures on thier profile page.
But we can't attach files to the profile page :(
fields.summary: I would be nice if I could attach files to my profile page

fields.description:
When using Confluence to create and distribute documentation for our internal projects, there is one nice feature missing.

It would be very nice if people could rate pages on a, say, 6 step scale on how good it is.

This would provide valuable feedback to the page authors as to whether the documentation is good enough.
fields.summary: RFE: Rate this page

given in bq.blockquotes bq.,.

should be given its own line
fields.summary: fix demo space text - formatting content

fields.description: Various misc improvements to the JIRA macros.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA macros

fields.description:
If the excerpt is less than 80 characters, look forward for a bigger one. If the excerpt is already 80 characters, and you hit a blank line, stop.

This should prevent excerpts that skip halfway into a new paragraph, or that just seem to grab single words or bogus attribution lines.
fields.summary: Improve mail excerpting slightly

fields.description:
new method search(String token, String query, Map params, int maxResults)

params can be:

"spaceKey" => limit by space key
"type" => limit by content type
"lastModified" => limit by last modified date
fields.summary: Limit remote API search by space/date/content types

fields.description:
Allow macro plugin definitions to specify a file that contains some HTML that should be inserted into the notation guide. The definition should state which page of the notation guide the HTML fragment should be inserted into (a macro can define a new page if it wants).

Disabled macros should not show up in the notation guide.

Do we need some way to order macros in the guide? (so that macro authors can ensure {set-foo} and {display-foo} are described next to each other)
fields.summary: Self-documenting macros

fields.description: As with JRA-835 (Add attachment when creating new issue), it would be really beneficial to add an attachment while creating a page.
fields.summary: Enable adding attachments while creating new page or news

fields.description:
Currently if I want to move an attachment to a different page you have to re-attach it, and thus loose all its history.
I wanna be able to move it, just like I can a page :)
fields.summary: it would be great it you could move attachments

fields.summary: Can't move page to the other space even after restart

fields.description: While the remote API doesn't let you do anything you wouldn't normally be able to do, it does make it a little _too_ easy to write an attack script. Some admins might want it turned off if nobody's using it.
fields.summary: Add preference to disable remote API

fields.description:
To improve performance of Confluence instances that might have a lot of external referrers:

1) Fix the getHotReferrers() method so that it only selects the hot ones
2) Cache hot referrers for 5 minutes
3) Queue incoming referrers to group all the DB writes.
fields.summary: Improve referrer links performance

fields.description: Clicking on a user whom has authored an imported page but does not have a profile within the current instance of Confluence brings a 404.
fields.summary: Importing a space carries users (authors) without profiles.

fields.description:
This functionality was working but has stopped. setupsuccess.vm checks an operation field in the setuppersister to see if demo content was installed. If it was, it displays a link to the homepage of the demo. space.

I know that it's broken for the custom install, need to test for the quick installation path.
fields.summary: Repair setup process - demo content && installed successful links to demo content homepage

fields.description: Lucene does not seem to index content within .xls or .doc files produced by OpenOffice.
fields.summary: Lucene indexing does not seem to work with open-office .doc or .xls files

fields.description: This would make it easier for users to script Confluence upgrades.
fields.summary: Trigger backups via remote API

fields.description: Due to a Postgresql implementation issue, none of our lookups against BIGINT columns (i.e. all our primary keys) actually use the indexes. We should find some kind of workaround (i.e. use NUMERIC columns on Postgres only), or preferably find a fix that will make our lookups cast the keys to the correct value.
fields.summary: Improve Postgresql performance

fields.description: Remove space link in spacelist.vm has 'Add Page' title text on the img
fields.summary: Remove space link in spacelist.vm has 'Add Page' title text on the img

fields.description:
Problem caused by both Page and Comment having different meanings for setParent(), but using the same column (PARENTID). This has confused Hibernate in cases where you load content via the Attachment object.

Fix: upgrade task that moves comment's "parent" field into the COMMENTPARENTID column.
fields.summary: Errors upgrading from 1.2 -> 1.3 under MySQL: net.sf.hibernate.PropertyAccessException: exception setting property value with CGLIB

fields.description: If you haven't explicitly set the thumbnail size settings (i.e. they're just the default of 200x200), then they get pushed back to 0x0 when you upgrade to 1.3
fields.summary: Thumbnail size settings lost on 1.2.3 -> 1.3-DR5 upgrade

fields.description:
The macros section of the notation guide organises information based on how a feature is implemented, not what it does. This is bad, because it makes it really hard to find features unless you either read the whole guide, or you already know how something is done.

The {color} macro is really a text effect, the {anchor} macro should be documented in the links section, {gallery} with images, and {html} under 'misc'.

We should then break the remaining macros into:

 - Advanced Formatting (noformat, code, panel)
 - External Content (rss, jiraissues, html-include)
 - Confluence Content (search, children, blog-posts, include, excerpt, excerpt-include, index}
fields.summary: Reorganise Notation Guide
Search macro does not search mail

fields.description: We should be able to use space rooted linking to refer to anything in the Space Summary or generic functionality within Confluence; e.g. a link to edit a certain page.
fields.summary: Create system link capability

fields.description: Index macro should display excerpts
fields.summary: Index macro to display excerpts

fields.description: The mail link is missing from the icons and descriptions of action on the opening view of Space Content.
fields.summary: Mail archive graphic and description should be placed on initial Content pane in Space Summary

fields.description: Passwords are visible on the screen when creating a mail account
fields.summary: Password field for creating a mail account is plain textfield

fields.description:
Hi.  Every time I add a new group, it is very tedioius to go back and click on each user, then click on edit groups, then click the new group, then click join, then click Back three times to get back to the list of users.  

I would like a group management interface: 
 * A (filtered) list of all users with checkboxes by their names.
 * filtered list should be able to show users _not_ in a group too.
 * check-all and uncheck-all links
 * a group dropdown
 * "add these users to group" button
 * "remove these users from group" button.  (no errors if they're not already in the group)

Other additions that would help: 
 * rename groups
 * re-sort groups
 * quickly see what space permissions a group has
fields.summary: Group management improvements

fields.summary: Importing space backup causes HibernateSystemException - not-null property references a null or transient value: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment.fileName

fields.description: I entered a page title which contained some 'special' character, which was just a slash (/). I also entered some text for the page. I clicked preview, and it gave me an error page saying I can't use certain characters. There was no 're-edit' or 'back' link on this page. I clicked my browser's back button (the only possible thing I could do), and all the information was lost, forcing me to re-enter it all from memory. Ouch! That's totally lame. Slashes, and many of the other characters are quite common for titles of articles and also blogs.
fields.summary: If you preview a page with a bad title, there's no 'back' and you lose your work

fields.description:
Would like to see the feature where we can 'brand' our installation of Confluence with a custom application title. It's a feature currently available in JIRA's admin console and it's extremely helpful. 

In our case, we want our installation to be the "Pentagon Library". Right now changing the title from "Confluence" to "Pentagon Library" involves editing quite a few velocity templates manually, which of course doesn't lend itself too well with Confluence upgrades.
fields.summary: Customized Application Title.

fields.description: This would make it much easier to write extensions that aggregate pages by their properties, which you currently can't do with the propertyset impl.
fields.summary: Index page-level properties in Lucene

fields.description: ampersands break links in Confluence
fields.summary: &s break links in Confluence
Task Macro should be installed in default build of Conf.
Create a date and time macro

fields.description: Choose distinct icons - see page operations menu
fields.summary: Move Page icon and Rename Page icon are identical

fields.description:
Add a space key -> space ID cache so we can convert by-key lookups to by-id lookups. This should make things much more efficient both from a db perspective, and from a "finding stuff in the Hibernate cache" perspective.

We do the same thing for pages already.

Remember to flush the cache when we delete a space.
fields.summary: Improve performance of getSpace(key)

fields.description:
To reproduce: 

New Blog Post
Specify title of "A & B"
Enter body text
Press Preview.

Page complains of '&' in title, but back button in browser results in loss of entered body text.   Add New Page doesn't have this problem.
fields.summary: Invalid character in new blog entry results in losing text entered

fields.description:
We are thinking of switching to Confluence from Twiki.  One thing that seems to be missing is notification for out-of-date pages.  We use this heavily in Twiki.  When you edit a page, you get a few radio buttons at the bottom of the edit page where you can select how long a page is valid for before it becomes out-of-date (a week, a month, a year, etc).

When a user visits an out-of-date page, there is a warning at the top that the page may be out-of-date.  As well, the last editor of the page receives an email periodically saying which pages are out-of-date.

I have attached an image of the bar that appears at the bottom of the edit page in Twiki.
fields.summary: Need out-of-date page tracking/notification
Provide support to hook in Maven results

fields.description:
The email footers that go out have Velocity syntax in them. This seems to affect the text and HTML footers.

Example:

Comment
---------------------------------------------------------------------

This looks very promising, but I'm going to have to wait until it supports {{HTTP}} access to repositories before I can try it.

Will the plugin support multiple repositories?
